summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Sixty-first Street, West Sixty-second Street and West Sixty-third Street, each from Eighth Avenue Northwest to a point three hundred (300) feet west of the west line of Fifteenth Avenue Northwest, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing sewers therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, openings, manholes, lampholes, flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1315 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
